title: (x) Ultra bold decorative constructed display face - Sinaloa {Mike Y, Tonie Blaze}
content:
![](http://web.archive.org/web/20080105062616im_/http:/typophile.com/files/Bilde228_5806.jpg)

I’m sure I’ve seen this before, I just don’t know where.

 [‹ (x) UNG 06/07 Young Swedish Design exhibition logo - Dynamo {Kate McDonnell}](http://web.archive.org/web/20080105062616/http:/typophile.com/node/40465 "Go to previous forum topic") [(x) A Celebration of Sex delicate script - Avalon {Marcelo R} ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20080105062616/http:/typophile.com/node/40461 "Go to next forum topic")
author: frode frank

comments.content:
Could you be thinking of [Sinaloa](http://web.archive.org/web/20080105062616/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/letraset/sinaloa/), which is similar?

- Mike Yanega

There was an old Letragraphica (Letraset) typeface called Sinaloa that has the same character design, but instead of two white line accents there are four. This might be an adaptation of that font (or vice-versa).

Actually, now that I study it, I think it is a simplification of Sinaloa, with fewer, broader white stripes.

- Mike Yanega
